observation: I can see a Specter.AI landing page with two main call-to-action buttons visible: 'Create Account' and 'Get Started'. There appear to be form elements below (email and password fields) but they are positioned very far down the page (y-coordinates around 1700+), suggesting I need to scroll down to access the actual signup form.
reasoning: As a normal user wanting to sign up, I can see there's a signup form below but it's not currently visible on screen. I need to scroll down to access the email and password input fields to complete the registration process.
ux_issues: Form elements are positioned too far down the page, requiring scrolling to access
Poor visual hierarchy - signup form not immediately visible after clicking signup buttons

outcome.visual_observation: The page successfully scrolled to reveal a complete account creation form with 'Create your account' heading, email input field (with placeholder 'you@example.com'), password field (with dots), password requirements text, 'Next' button, and 'Already have an account? Sign in' link at the bottom.
